article:
, Causeway Bay]] , Yau Ma Tei]] ]] Over 70 temples are (at least partially)
dedicated to Tin Hau in Hong Kong. [http://www.discoverhong-
kong.com/festivehk2010/eng/traditional/birthday_of_tin_hau/highlight_highlights-
.jsp Birthday of Tin Hau: Highlights] They include:

* Tin Hau temple, located at 10 Tin Hau Temple Road, Causeway Bay, east of
  Victoria Park, in Eastern District, on Hong Kong Island. It is a declared
  monument. Antiquities and Monuments Office:
  [http://www.amo.gov.hk/en/monuments_15.php Tin Hau Temple, Causeway Bay]
  The temple has given its name to the MTR station serving it (Island Line).

* The Tin Hau temple in Yau Ma Tei is also famous in Hong Kong. The public
  square, Yung Shue Tau before it is surrounded by the popular Temple Street
  night market.

* The Tin Hau Temple at Joss House Bay (å¤§å»ç£; Tai Miu Wan) is considered the most
  sacred. Built in 1266, it is the oldest and the largest Tin Hau Temple in Hong
  Kong. [http://www.ctc.org.hk/en/directcontrol/temple20.asp Chinese Temples
  Committee - Tin Hau Temple, Joss House Bay] It is a Grade I historic
  building. [http://www.amo.gov.hk/form/historical.pdf List of
  Graded Historic Buildings in Hong Kong (as at 6 Jan 2007)]
categories: Places of worship in Hong Kong
